abstract: Israel has been quietly legalizing outpost settlements established without government permission in Israeli-occupied West Bank; critics have accused right-wing government of trying to change map of West Bank and see outposts as evidence that Israel has abandoned possibility of two-state solution with Palestinians.
lead_paragraph: Unauthorized settlements dot hilltops in the West Bank, and anti-settlement groups and Palestinians say retroactively legalizing them is a methodical effort to change the region’s map.
snippet: Unauthorized settlements dot hilltops in the West Bank, and anti-settlement groups and Palestinians say retroactively legalizing them is a methodical effort to change the region’s map....

headline.main: Israel Quietly Legalizes Pirate Outposts in the West Bank
headline.print_headline: Israel Legalizes Outposts in the West Bank, Step by Quiet Step
